titlestmt.titleproper: College of Physicians of Philadelphia Sections records 1894-1999
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: College of Physicians of Philadelphia Sections records

bioghist.p: The College of Physicians of Philadelphia, founded in 1787, is the oldest professional medical organization in the country. The College is home to the MÃ¼tter Museum, the Historical Medical Library, the C. Everett Koop Community Education Center, and PhillyHealthInfo.org. Beginning in 1893, with the establishment of the Section on Ophthalmology, Fellows of the College began to organize discipline- and practice-specific working groups. Other Sections include Basic Science, Dermatology, Gynecology, Internal Medicine, Medical History, Orthopedic Surgery, Otology and Laryngology, Public Health, Surgery, and the Blockley Section.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of various Sections of the College of Physicians of Philadelphia. Types of materials to be found among these records include correspondence, annual reports and other reports, minutes, printed materials such as newsletters and reprints, membership lists, lists of speakers and lecture topics, photographs, publicity files and notes on promotional ideas. The largest grouping of records within this collection is that of the Section on Medical History. This Sections' records date from 1966 to 1995. Sets of records for other Sections are comparatively small, and include Dermatology, Surgery, Orthopedic Surgery, Gynecology, Otology and Laryngology, Internal Medicine, Basic Sciences, and the Blockley Section.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
